findings.description: The total ticketsCount is incremented twice per purchase: once before updating ticketsCountByBuyer and again after. This makes ticketsCount twice the actual total tickets (sum of ticketsCountByBuyer). In calculateWinner, winningTicketIndex = blockhash % ticketsCount ranges from 0 to 2t-1 (t=actual total), but the loop accumulates only up to t. If winningTicketIndex >= t (~50% probability assuming uniform hash), no return statement executes, causing calculateWinner to revert (Solidity requires return value). Thus, cash reverts, locking the subpot forever.
findings.reasoning: This finding is related to the target vulnerability but focuses on a different issue (double increment of ticketsCount) and is not the primary vulnerability.

findings.description: Winner selection loops over the entire buyers array, accumulating ticketsCountByBuyer for each. With many unique buyers (e.g., >50,000), the loop exceeds gas limit (~5M gas in old EVM), causing revert. cash calls this, preventing payouts.
findings.reasoning: This finding is related to the target vulnerability but focuses on a different issue (gas exhaustion due to large buyers array) and is not the primary vulnerability.

findings.description: Uses block.blockhash(decisionBlockNumber), available only for last 256 blocks. If cash called >256 blocks after decision block, hash=0, winningTicketIndex=0, always selecting first buyers[0] as winner (since accumulation starts at 0 and first buyer's tickets >0 triggers return).
findings.reasoning: This finding is related to the target vulnerability but focuses on a different issue (weak randomness due to blockhash) and is not the primary vulnerability.

findings.description: Subpots are equal-sized: num = floor(pot / blockReward) + (pot % blockReward > 0). Each pays pot / num (floored). Total payout = num * (pot / num) <= pot; remainder (pot % num) left in contract, unclaimable as all isCashed true, no withdrawal mechanism.
findings.reasoning: This finding is related to the target vulnerability but focuses on a different issue (funds loss due to unequal subpots) and is not the primary vulnerability.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The target vulnerability (unchecked_return) was not mentioned in any of the findings.

notes: None of the findings correctly identified the target vulnerability (unchecked_return). All findings were related to the target but focused on different issues.
